reportable="true" pass="true" /><CompletedIndoorAirPLUS type="Check" name="Completed Indoor airPLUS?" optional="true" reportable="true" pass="" /><inspectionnotes type="Notes" name="Inspection Notes">Initial feild vist on 4/13/12 and tested home at 807 cfm. The tape on the OSB had failed and was causing considerable leakage. Transition from sill to concrete slab and transition from wall to ceiling were also areas of considerable leakage. Used an infaraed camera to pin point leakage areas and pointed out to builder to seal with foam or caulk. Saw the stickers on the NFRC windows-.20. 2nd site visit i set up blower door while they had volunteers seal with foam, got home down to 432 cfm (2.49 ACH50. Spoke with builder about caulking each peice to try and meet the Passive House requirement of .6 ACH 50, contractor ended up not having the sheetrockers do this because of added cost. He is aware that it will be a requirement in 2013. 3rd site visit I retested and the home was 380 cfm (2.19 ACH50). At this time I verified the light and water fixtures for energy start and minimums.</inspectionnotes><shell type="Notes" name="Shell">R-59 walls 0r .016 U-value, slab insulated to R-50 (R-20 on slab edge, Ceilings insulated to R-65. Doors verified energy star via stickers, windows U-value of .22 and 13% of total sqft, 2.19 ACH50.</shell><lighting type="Notes" name="Lighting">Verified energy star bulbs and fixtures while still in package, not yet installed on final test out.</lighting><water type="Notes" name="Water">Verified water fixtures meet minimum requirements, still in package onsite during final test out.</water><hvac type="Notes" name="Heating/Cooling">Heat via electric zonal wall heaters</hvac><other type="Notes" name="Other">Ventilation provde by a ComfoAir 200 (HRV, Balanced by Matt Groves on 7/12/12)</other></inspector></bop>
